qas.question: In what year was Mercury Records (US) bought out?
What is the name of CBS' Mexican record label?
Columbia/ABC began negotiations with Philips Records in what year?
Which company wanted to start its own local record company?
Mercury Records acquired Philips in the US in what year?
Philips Records distributed the music in what area?
CBS's Chinese record company was called Discos what?

context: In <b3_0>1960<b3_0/>, Columbia/CBS began negotiations with its main international distributor <a1_0>Philips Records<a1_0/> with the goal of <b4_0>CBS<b4_0/> starting its own global record company. Philips' acquisition of Mercury Records in the US in <a0_0><b5_0>1961<b5_0/><a0_0/> paved the way for this. CBS only had the rights to the Columbia name in North America; therefore the international arm founded in 1961 and launched in 1962 utilized the "CBS Records" name only, with Philips Records distributing the label in <b6_0>Europe<b6_0/>. CBS's Mexican record company, Discos <b7_0>Columbia<b7_0/>, was renamed <a2_0>Discos CBS<a2_0/> by 1963.
